blog.name: sophiestarke
blog.title: the pack survives
blog.description:
🇨🇦 / ♌️ 16

Chrissy | Formerly theoldthetruethebravee |header is a gif by stark

summary:
Hello, hello. Welcome back to Chrissy’s metas. Take a seat. This is going to be an interesting one. 
There has been so many...
body:
How Sansa Stark led to the deaths of Cersei’s children

Hello, hello. Welcome back to Chrissy’s metas. Take a seat. This is going to be an interesting one.

There has been so many debates as to who the “younger more beautiful queen” of Cersei’s undoing will be. And I am completely convinced it is Sansa Stark, mostly because Sansa is the catalyst that led to Joffrey, Myrcella and Tommens deaths.

First of all, Sansa literally held the poison that would kill Joffrey on her neck.

She’s the one that brought the poison in, and helped Olenna kill Joffrey. If it weren’t for Sansa and her keeping the poison, or Sansa confessing what Joffrey is truly like, Olenna may have never killed Joffrey, or her attempt wouldn’t have worked.

Tommen and Myrcella’s deaths are more so butterfly effects of Sansa’s actions. By Olenna killing Joffrey due to Sansa, Margaery Tyrell went on to marry Tommen. Cersei grew angry because of Margaery’s effect on her last living son, and as we all know, tried to bring down House Tyrell using the Faith to lower their power. The result of that is Tommen’s suicide.

So, if Sansa would never have told Olenna and wore the necklace, Joffrey wouldn’t have died, and same with Tommen.

And now for Myrcella. Myrcella was shipped off to Dorne early season 2, I believe, and before both Joffrey or Tommen’s deaths. But how Myrcella died was as well, a butterfly effect caused by-you guessed it, Sansa Stark.

By fleeing the scene at Joffrey’s wedding, Sansa left Tyrion to be arrested for Joffrey’s murder, as a “big suspect”. And, Oberyn Martell agreed to be his champion, and died during the match with the Mountain. Since Ellaria was traumatized by seeing Oberyn die like that, she and the Sand Snakes (for some reason idk, the Dorne plot, as we all know, was awful) decided to kill Myrcella.

There you have it. Sansa Stark is the catalyst and the reason Cersei’s children died.

summary: When Sansa and Arya reunite, I hope they go hawking together. Since Sansa liked hawking with Margaery and Catelyn told Arya she...
caption: When Sansa and Arya reunite, I hope they go hawking together. Since Sansa liked hawking with Margaery and Catelyn told Arya she could have a hawk when she was older, I see it as one of the few activities both girls enjoy and can bond over.

question: Ship ask: jonsa
answer:
vomit / don’t ship / okay / cute / adorable / perfect / beyond flawless / hot damn / screaming and crying / i will ship them in hell

I can’t say this with 100% certainty but if I enjoyed Jon’s character, this might be one of my lowkey Sansa ships. You definitely have to like both Jon and Sansa because the fandom is really about the both of them. Unfortunately, I only care about Sansa.

summary: stalking my favorite jonsa blogs (luv u guys) and wanted to share with the fam something since saw talk of the ga's reactions to...
question: stalking my favorite jonsa blogs (luv u guys) and wanted to share with the fam something since saw talk of the ga's reactions to the teasers and supporting sansa. i watch got with ga friends with very different favs and half almost didnt finish s5 because of sansa's wedding night and seeing her that next ep. and ALL of us agree s6 reunion and taking winterfell storyline was the best hands down because it was jon AND sansa. she is much more beloved than the vocal fandom bits lead u to believe!
answer:
Dear nonny,

thanks for this! Just forwarding this to the Jonsa fam and the Stark supporters!

And thank you for the love!

summary: It's funny, people always call Sansa whiny or spoiled because they cling to their season one first impressions, but in my...
question: It's funny, people always call Sansa whiny or spoiled because they cling to their season one first impressions, but in my rewatch, I've noticed that Jon is actually just as much if not more so whiny and arrogant, yet he only gets labeled "broody" and praised. Really makes you think.
answer:
Men can have so so many flaws and it would get ignored or it becomes part of their charm. The same can’t be said for women especially teenage girls. How many times have we seen people hate things that teenage girls like? Justin Bieber was bullied because his fanbase was made up of preteens and teen girls. People talk about Beatle fans like they’re unusually fanatic as if football fans don’t weep at the sight of their favourite player. Books beloved by teenage girls are derided. No one wants to related to young girls. Often the character everyone hates is a teenage girl unless she’s a tomboy who rolls her eyes at makeup and boys.

Most of the GoT fanbase refused to see things from Sansa’s POV, they could have because it’s not Inception but they didn’t want to. They didn’t want to know why she was so angry after Lady died. They didn’t care about the awkward position the betrothal had left her, that she was essentially transitioning from one family to another. Now D&D are trash writers but this isn’t on them. Is it surprising that Jon can share character traits with Sansa and only receive a fraction of the hate that she got? No because people are always willing to try for male characters (for example Sharon Carter has no personality but the way Bucky blinked means something). Nowadays people are being pushed to enjoy female characters with complexities but often their fans are largely women.

Sansa only started gaining traction with the public when she suffered unimaginably. That’s the only way people would be empathetic to her. It’s why rape and abuse are plot devices to this day. People withhold empathy for female characters who don’t behave in acceptable masculine ways and the only thing that can change their mind is gendered violence and most importantly the response. Female characters who freeze, become timid or teaful for a significant amount of time (a few episodes sometimes) are still disliked but those who respond coldly, with anger, by ‘toughening’ up are seen as more likable. Book Sansa’s response to trauma could not have made it on screen because people just aren’t ready to accept it.

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

summary: “Another lesson you should learn, if you hope to sit beside my son. Be gentle on a night like this and you’ll have treasons...
caption:
“Another lesson you should learn, if you hope to sit beside my son. Be gentle on a night like this and you’ll have treasons popping up all about you like mushrooms after a hard rain. The only way to keep your people loyal is to make certain they fear you more than they do the enemy.”

“I will remember, Your Grace,” said Sansa, though she had always heard that love was a surer route to the people’s loyalty than fear. If I am ever a queen, I’ll make them love me.

“I will remember, Your Grace,” said Sansa, though she had always heard that love was a surer route to the people’s loyalty than fear. If I am ever a queen, I’ll make them love me.
